A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The leads were great\, but were barely allowed to act. Lots of fillers\, pointless characters (or rather caricatures)\, and sit-com jokes while serious themes could be explored. Whole scenes that were pointless\, blatant adoption of the style of the animated series "Avatar the Last Airbener" (which is a great series). Pointless\, blatant\, biased political speeches forgetting the very core of the starwars idea of balance. In short\, let the actors do their job and tell a good story - this is a movie\, not a collection of random fan fiction ideas. Cut the meat. I really liked the interaction of the light and dark side leads - give them room.

The effects were great\, but too much self-indulging and removed from the established world. The inclusion of marketing material and cute and cuddly animals made my skin crawl with embarrassment.

SPOILER

If a fleet of Stardestroyers could be easily destroyed by ramming\, such fleets would never be built. The result looked cool though\, although more fitting in an anime. It was sad to see Finn\, a very interesting character that opened many opportunities for interesting insights and stories\, relegated to just one more side show among many.
